com.sendev.databasemanager

Class ConnectionContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sendev.databasemanager.ConnectionContainer

  • public class ConnectionContainer
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectionContainer(DatabaseManager dbm)
      Creates a new database connection container instance, making it easier to store, manage and use the database connections parsed to the Database Manager.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addConnection(java.lang.String name, ConnectionLevel level, Database connection)
      Adds a database connection to the connections container, allowing queries to be run against the connection.
      Database getConnection(java.lang.String connection)
      Gets the database connection associated with the given name, if there isn't any database connection with the given name, NULL will be returned instead.
      Database getDefaultConnection()
      Returns the default database connection, if there are not default connection the database with the highest database connection level will be returned instead.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionContainer

        public ConnectionContainer(DatabaseManager dbm)
        Creates a new database connection container instance, making it easier to store, manage and use the database connections parsed to the Database Manager.
        Parameters:
        dbm -
        See Also:
        DatabaseManager

    • Method Detail

      • addConnection

        public boolean addConnection(java.lang.String name,
                             ConnectionLevel level,
                             Database connection)
        Adds a database connection to the connections container, allowing queries to be run against the connection.

        The connection level will be used to determine the priority of the connection, the top level will always be DEFAULT, after that the it's HIGEST, HIGE, MEDIUM, etc...

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the connection.
        level - The level/priority of the connection.
        connection - The database instance, this can be MySQL, SQLite, etc...
        Returns:
        True if the connection was added successfully, or False if the connection name already exists.

      • getConnection

        public Database getConnection(java.lang.String connection)
        Gets the database connection associated with the given name, if there isn't any database connection with the given name, NULL will be returned instead.
        Parameters:
        connection - The name of the connection to fetch.
        Returns:
        either (1) the database connection instance with the given name or (2) NULL if the no database instance exists with the given name

      • getDefaultConnection

        public Database getDefaultConnection()
        Returns the default database connection, if there are not default connection the database with the highest database connection level will be returned instead.
        Returns:
        either (1) The default or highest level database connection or (2) NULL if there are no connections in the container.
